values:
My last Christmas break starts in apx. 3+ hours depending on how long my final will take me.  That is just crazy to think about.

It seems like facebook keeps telling me people are getting engaged/having babies.  I feel way too young and it is weird to believe that kids I went to elementary school with are "old" enough.

I go to Charlotte tomorrow to work the Neil Diamond concert.  I am very excited.  I absolutley love concerts.  The enviroment and live performances is absolutely amazing.
http://lizzybug57.livejournal.com/48307.html

A year has passed since I last posted on LJ.  I don't really know why I decided to write again.  I take that back.  Perhaps I do.  I read or heard or somehow got this idea in my head that blogging is supposed to be the "thing" to do.  I always looked at it as a way to put what is happening in one's life down on paper or in this case type it on the computer. 

 I've also heard keeping a blog is a good thing for journalists to do, which reminds me that I had to post a news story I wrote for class on blogspot.  It's not like I would post a personal blog and then use that as a writing sample for job applications.  "Here Mr. Recruiter is a link to my personal blog.  Read all about me."  


I guess writing on this blog will help clear the air.  I have spent the past 3 months in Salt Lake City interning and living with my brother.  It has been a great experience career wise and to get to really KNOW my brother.  It has also been extremely difficult.  This is the first time in my life I have really been ALONE for a period of time.  I  have always had friends wherever I have gone.  Out here, I started fresh with no friends.  While I enjoy spending time with my brother and his friends and also occasionally hang out with some other people, I do not have any "true" kindred spirits out here.  

Perhaps this is a time to reflect on how my life has been thus far and how it will change a year from now.  I may start completely over next summer with a job somewhere where I know noone.  This may be practice for that.

On a brighter more upbeat note, my internship with a concert promoter is pretty kickass.  I am getting to work concerts and see A List celebrities on a regular basis.  (well C list too if you count Justin Guarini lol.)

I feel better now.  Hopefully I can make posting on this priority on a regular basis.
http://lizzybug57.livejournal.com/47884.html

I just realized (perhaps 5-10 minutes ago) that I haven't been on LJ in about 3 months.  

Right now I am at Ronald McDonald House.  Last night I went shoe and apartment stuff shopping with my mommy.  My apartment isn't gonna be perfectly ready when I move in; however, it will be AMAZING!  I am soooo excited.  I am getting my bedding, curtains, and shower curtain made; so, they won't be ready.  I am getting this searsucker comforter to do in the meantime.  I bought these really cool pictures yesterday and am just really excited about my apartment.

I turn 20 in about a month which is tres exciting.  I will no longer be a teenager (GASP!).

Next weekend is the Big Scoop Ice cream festival for Ronald McDonald House.  I have been working and spending a tremendous amount of time on it.  Hopefully it will be a success.  

My brother and his girl friend come in town tomorrow.

The weekend after Big Scoop in Nashville and JOHN MAYER!!!!  Big yay for that!   That following Monday is JUSTIN TIMBERLAKE!!!  I then move into my apartment (August 11th).

Basically this summer is wrapping up quite nicely, and I am very stoked about what is to come.
http://lizzybug57.livejournal.com/47867.html

Finals are pretty much a terrible time of year.  It means the end is almost here but not quite.  Because of finals, the end seems far away.  Plus I'm a terrible procrastinator and suck at studying.  This semester it seems to be especially hard for me to sit down and study.

From 4-7 today there is a dinner/awards thing at the aquatic center for all rec center employees.  Free dinner is pretty cool; so, I'm excited.  

After that I work from 6-9 where I am going to study and then go spend the night in the library.  Get excited.  This will be one exciting night.  Not.  

Hopefully I will do well on my finals.  

Music Fest on Sunday.  Get excited about some Counting Crows...
http://lizzybug57.livejournal.com/47472.html

I am going home tomorrow for Easter break.  I have not been to Memphis since Christmas break.  I am so excited about seeing my pets and getting to hang out with my Memphis friends.  I am also excited about going to the  Commissary and shopping with my mom:)  

Memphis this weekend=yay!

Oh and I am going to see John Mayer August 3rd(I think...it is whenever that Friday is) in Nashville with Lan.  That following Monday, I am seeing Justin Timberlake at the Forum.
http://lizzybug57.livejournal.com/47278.html

So I packed today.  I then unpacked and repacked.  I am pretty sure I have been trying to pack too much.  I want to have plenty of room to put everything I buy in.  I have a feeling I am going to repack again and perhaps again.  I am just a terrible packer.  I never have things that match, and I never pack what I need.  That is why I decided to pack a lot of stuff so that I wouldn't be in that situation.  Then I was reminded I needed to room to bring everything I buy back to the U.S.  

I also bought Cosmo and US weekly to read on the plane.  I got candy too.  I'm also gonna bring a deck of cards.  

I am soooo freakin excited about the trip!  Yay Spain!!!
http://lizzybug57.livejournal.com/47091.html
I'm getting really excited about Spain.  less than 2 weeks!  yay!
http://lizzybug57.livejournal.com/46594.html

tvguide.com has a really nice look back at the history of the O.C.  I think it is good it is ending tonight, but this season has been really good.  This is the 3rd show that I have really really loved that is ending for me.  Roswell ended followed by Dawson's Creek.  Dawson's Creek ended in May, and that August the O.C. premiered.  The O.C. was the answer to what was I going to watch since Dawson's ended.  It came at a great time for me, and if teens weren't so fickle and didn't give up so easily, perhaps it would still be airing.  Things aren't that way, and I say farewell to the O.C.  I think tonight's episode will be good since we are promised everyone in the O.C. will be happy, and all loose ends will be tied up.  Yay for that!  I'm going to get a pint of Ben and Jerry's and watch the O.C. tonight happily.  Screw you, Grey's Anatomy!  I'm watching you online later.  

John Mayer announced today that he is extending his Continuum tour.  CD sales have increased 180% since the Grammy's resulting it to be on the top 10 cd selling charts this week.  Yay for that!  Anyways he is touring this summer, and I will be going to see him August 3rd in Nashville.  Yay for that as well!

Glad it is almost the weekend.  I have a test tomorrow.  I had one this past Monday.  I have one this coming up Monday.  Too many tests....
http://lizzybug57.livejournal.com/46340.html

He was absolutely wonderful and went crazy with guitar solos! His best song was Gravity becauuse he just went crazy with it and got really into it.  It was absolutely wonderful.  Here is set list:

Belief
Bigger Than My Body
Why Georgia
I Don't Trust Myself (With Loving You)
Vultures
Neon
The Heart of Life
Waiting on the World to Change
No Such Thing
Good Love is On the Way
Gravity

-- encore --
3x5
Your Body is a Wonderland
In Repair
http://lizzybug57.livejournal.com/46242.html
One day until John Mayer!  This time tomorrow I will be at the concert!!!!
http://lizzybug57.livejournal.com/46049.html

So I know it's the new CW...I get that.  I've also noticed WB shows are on it, but today I just found an article talking about the end of the WB.  Apparently in September for it's final day, the WB showed pilots of its best shows.  It also showed highlights of it's career.  The pilots shown were Buffy, Angel, Felicity, and it ended with Dawson's Creek.

Apparently Entertainment Weekly also had a countdown with the best WB moments.  Number 1 was when Buffy killed Angel (my favorite Buffy episode...haha!) and when Felicity cut her hair, and Dawson declared his love for Katie Couric.  It also had when people sent in tobasco to try and save Roswell.  

Me finding this article brought back so many memories of my favorite tvs and tv show moments!
http://lizzybug57.livejournal.com/45650.html

So some good things happened today.  Well one in particular.  I got the PR internship with the athletic department.  big yay!!!

Erin's blog reminded me that Valentine's Day is coming up.  That sucks.  It reminds those of us who are eternally single that we are eternally single.  

Last night I went to Clement and hung out with Bryan, Chad, and Andy.  Mimsy, Courtney, and MA were there at certain points as well.  We drank beer and played Grand Theft Auto.  Am I such a boy????  I think perhaps.

In a little while I'm going to the TRECS to meet Katie and Nicole.  I haven't worked out in over a week cuz I've been sick.  I'm worried I can't handle that step and tone class right now.  haha.
http://lizzybug57.livejournal.com/45335.html

1. What is your name?
Elizabeth

2. What color is your bra?
not wearing one cuz I'm sick.

3. Do you straighten your hair everyday?
no, that would take too long.

4. Do you worry about the size of your boobs?
Sometimes I call my boobs the place where my breasts should be since mine are incredibly small.  Yes, I guess it does worry me.  

5. Are you the typical girl who's addicted to gossip?
Ya I like to hear my share of gossip.

6. What's your favorite girly magazine?
cosmo

7. Best junk food?
candy and ice cream

8. Would you kill for chocolate?
never

10. Jeans or skirts?:
I do like jeans; however skirts are comfy.  

11. Do you wear clothes/shoes/jewelry that's uncomfortable?
Ya, that is part of  being a girl.

12. Did you ever spend all day/night getting pretty for a guy?:
Prom.  I also like to look nice for parties.

13. Did you ever cry during a romantic movie?
I'm a wuss when it comes to crying at movies.

14. Would you leave the house without makeup on?:
yes unfortunately.

15. What's the biggest turn on about guys?
build/hair

16. What about the biggest turn off?
I dunno...

17. Do you consider making out "unladylike"?
Haha...I tend to be a makeout whore, but I don't think I'm unladylike.  

18. On a scale of 1-10, how fun is shopping?
10 when my mom takes me shopping.

19. Are you a girly-girl, tomboy, or in the middle?
I love pink and girly stuff, but I still have my sporty casual side.

20. Do you think lipgloss is the best?:
ya

21. Do you HAVE to have a boyfriend at all times?
No, I actually tend to find flaws with pretty much every guy.

22. Do you freak out if you miss your favorite show?
Yes!!!

23. Do you obsess over your looks?:
Sometimes...

24. How long does it take you to get ready in the morning?
Haha not as long as it should.  I value sleep.

25.Do you wear sweatpants/pajama pants to school?
Yes.  


26. Accessories make the outfit; true or false:
true

27. Are you a sucker for skater guys?
Hell no.

28. What kind of guys do you like?
I think preppy guys are hot but tend to be assholes.  I kinda have this thing for the bad boys, but they are no good.  I dunno...I like all different types of guys I guess.

29. Is pink truly the best color in the entire universe?
YES

30. Lip gloss a must?:
wasn't there already a question about lipgloss?

34. Do you take the chance on Halloween to dress like a whore?
Not true, Erin.  I celebrated Halloween in Gtown.  Yes, Halloween=dressing like a whore.  I was a bumblebee this year.  Haha.

35. Ever dressed like a whore to impress a guy?
no

36. Do you change the way you look to impress a guy?
No

37. Has a guy ever given you something on Valentines?
flowers

38. Gold or silver?
white gold.

39. The guy that you like/love/whatever, what does his name begin with?:
no one

41. Do you dress up too much for holidays?:
I like holidays.  

42. Do you like wearing dresses?:
ya, I own a lot of cute dresses.

43. Do you write a lot of mushy love poems?:
what?  hell no!

44. Do you consider yourself to be fashionable?
I own tons of cute  clothes.  I don't always put them together correctly.  

45. On a scale of 1-10, how much do guys confuse you?
10

47. Do you worry/fuss about your weight?
no


48. Do you eat junk food?
yes

49. Do you work out?
I now workout 3 times a week (holla!) with Katie and Nicole.

50. What makeup product could you NOT live without?
concealer
http://lizzybug57.livejournal.com/44920.html

Reading Katie's entry reminded me that seasonal depression exists.  Perhaps I can blame January on me suddenly having girl thoughts.  Usually I brush stuff off and it doesn't bother me; however, the past few days I have been consumed with over analyzing girl thoughts.  It's annoying, and I don't like it.  I'm just gonna blame it on January...
http://lizzybug57.livejournal.com/44704.html
Last night was crazy.  2 kegs, and they both floated.
http://lizzybug57.livejournal.com/44304.html

So the following is my away message on AIM:

"I'm loving that Grey's won best tv drama

...however I am once again reminded that Grey's is partially at fault for the demise of the o.c.  

it may be the o.c.'s time, but this really is a great season, and noone seems to notice because Grey's is sooo big.

Kudos to the o.c. for poking fun at Grey's.  They deserve it."

To continue with that, the o.c. has always been able to make of itself, and it had no chance this season.  FOX was completely stupid to not move it to a different time slot.  FOX also did a bad job at promos.

So while my tv loving heart is now with Grey's (esp. after the series finale of the o.c. in February), I am about to lose a show that has been very dear to me.  

I haven't lost a show in awhile. I believe Buffy was the last one, but to be honest I didn't stick with Buffy and Angel to the end.  I guess for the shows I stuck with beginning to end, my last was Dawson's Creek.  That ended in 10th grade.  It's been awhile for me, and I love the o.c. I love that season Josh Schwartz was set to make a quality season instead of just giving into quantity and hype and the pressures of being a primetime television show.


....

On a different note but still on tv and having to do with Grey's, I'd like to say Patrick Dempsey looked very yummmy tonight.  

Ellen Pompeo looked very nice as well.  I do not think she is particularly beautiful on Grey's, but I thought she looked really nice tonight.

I bet that cast is gonna have a good night.  haha.

...

So I am on this exercise kick.  It's the first time in a long time that I really have been serious about being fit.

I saw Dr. Ian (from Celebrity Fit Club) earlier today.  Katie Stokes, Nicole German, and I went.  

I am really wanting to get my life together this semester.  I'm really wanting to work hard on ME.  I want to be introspective and work on my major and my career goals.  I also want to do really well in school and become engaged in my classes.  


I'd like to also make some new friends.  You can never have too many friends.  I'd also like to get more involved on campus and really discover who I am and have more to do.

I guess this has been a really serious entry.  Wow.
http://lizzybug57.livejournal.com/44081.html

Lan, Mallory, Kaitlin, people frome the centre....

track but not senior year.

football games

no

no, but I went on school trips a lot.  haha.

i would consider myself more of a goody 2 shoes than a nerd...

no, but i got detention for 3 days for parking in the front circle drive

there was that song they sang when the football team scored and the cheerleaders did the push ups...

Mrs. Adams (freshman English), Frau, Mrs. Zimmerman, Coach Terrell (but I never had him)

APUSH or English

Germantown High School

The Red Devil

yup 3 years in a row

I liked high school, but I wouldn't want to have to do it again.

18. What do you remember most about graduation?
uhhh Dr. Harris giving me a hug and asking if it had really been 4 years.

19. Favorite memory of your Senior Year?
I dunno what my favorite memory of senior was.  I guess I don't have one.  Is that depressing?

20. Where were you on senior skip day?
at school or on a school sponsered absense.

21.Did you have a job your senior year?
Germantown Centre baby

22. Where did you go most often for lunch?
lunch room with Kaitlin and Mallory

23. Have you gained weight since then?
uhhh a little probably

24. What did you do after graduation?
Went to my house and then to project graduation

May 05

Ben Gabor...haha long funny story.

yup fo sho.  My brother just went to his and really enjoyed it.

28. Who was your home room teacher?
Ms. Marose(sp?) and Coach Terrell

29. Who will repost this after you?
I dunno---noone?  everyone? 

30. Who was President of student council?
Ummm Drew was our class president.  Brittany Henderson and Mary Lynn were copresidents of SGA

31. Nickname:
Liz
http://lizzybug57.livejournal.com/43966.html

Let's see.  Lot's happened during the break.  

Mostly my brand new pink razor got stolen on New  Year's Eve.  I hope that is  not a sign of how 2007 is going to go...

Katie and I got  back to Knox last night.  I went over to Christa's, and it was good to see everyone again.  I really missed my Knox friends though I did have a good time in Memphis.

It's weird---having friends back home and then friends in Knox.  I don't really know who I'm closer to.  I grew up with the Memphis people, but I literally tend to LIVE with the Knoxville people.

I have a lot of things I need to do.  Class starts tomorrow, and I am excited about some of my classes.  I know that sounds nerdy, and I'm probably going to regret saying that in about ummm 2 days when I'm gonna want to not have to go to school.  Honsetly though the only class I'm not really ok with is German.  I can't stand foreign language class, but this is my last semester of German.  That is exciting.

I really hope I do enjoy these class as much as I anticipate I will.  I also hope I excell in them.  I really need to have a high GPA this semester.

We'll see how it goes...
http://lizzybug57.livejournal.com/43586.html

I am going crazy, but I keep reminding myself all I have left is today.  

I have my German final (which should be rather reasy) and my math final (which probably won't be).  

I have been doing math problems for hours and still feel like there is so much to learn.

This sucks.

German final is from 12:30-2:30

Math final is from 5:00-7:00.

Then I think I want to sleep.  As of right now, I have little if any desire to go out tonight.  Instead I want to watch the O.C. and sleep.  Sleeping is vital for me.  I don't go without sleep, and right now I am.

I was an idiot and procrastinated to study.  I always do that, and I never learn.

Why doesn't CPO have some of my grades up yet?  This is pissing me off...
http://lizzybug57.livejournal.com/43338.html

I don't like finals time, but then who does?  All I want to is either go out and be wild crazy....or go home and watch nonstop tv with my puppy.  Instead I am stuck studying.  

Oh and it is 14 degrees in Knoxville.  Needless to say, I'm not walking to the library; so, studying in the dorms it is.  

My speech teacher emailed our grades (without the final) so we have an idea of how we're gonna do.  i have a b without the final; so, i should make an A in the class which is awesome.  i need as many A's as I can get.

I definately think my grades will be better this semester than last....last semester I had a little too much fun to say the least.

All I really need to do is keep my GPA up so I don't lose my scholarships.  That shouldn't be too hard.

I'm ready for XMas!!!  I love Christmas season but am not really experiencing it all that much yet because of finals.
http://lizzybug57.livejournal.com/43014.html

SO i have lost my phone.  sorta.  i had it yesterday at my friend's apartment...but then i was ready to leave i couldnt find it which means i dont have it and i wont have it all weekend.  crap.

i am listening to christmas music that i burned on a cd this past weekend.  i think Josh Groban's "Oh Holy Night" pretty much sums up Christmas.  It is a beautiful song and makes me want to drop down to my knees and pray...which is saying a lot since i am certainly not religious.  

There are just certain songs that just really move you. 

I get to go home in a couple of hours which is way exciting.  I am ready to go home and see my mommy and my puppy and Lan and Mallory and Dominique.  Yay for Memphis!
http://lizzybug57.livejournal.com/42961.html

IF YOUR LIFE WAS A MOVIE, WHAT WOULD THE SOUNDTRACK BE?

So, here's how it works:
1. Open your library (iTunes, Winamp, Media Player, iPod, etc)
2. Put it on shuffle
3. Press play
4. For every question, type the song that's playing
5. When you go to a new question, press the next button
6. Don't lie and try to pretend you're cool...

Opening Credits: "Music of the Night" by Andrew Lloyd Webber.  hmm...this is my favorite Phantom song.  Go Itunes:)

Waking Up: "Everything" By Lifehouse.  This song is really intense.  Remember the concert at Shelby Farms, Katie?

First Day of High School: "Perfect Time of Day" by Howie Day.  I don't even know what to say about this...

Falling In Love: "3 x 5" by John Mayer.  It is a love song---a very good one at that:)

Fight Song: "God Only Knows" by the Beach Boys hmmm....

Breaking Up: "Virgin State of Mind" by K's Choice on the Buffy soundtrack.  Interesting choice for breaking up...

Prom: "I'm Gonna Make you Love me" by the Jayhawks.  It is off of the Dawson's Creek soundtrack.

First Day of College: "Come Lay Down" by Howie Day.  hmmm...there tends to be lots of sleepovers/crashing in college.  Does that work a little?

Mental Breakdown: "Lucky" by Bif Naked also on the Buffy soundtrack.  It's weird I don't seem to be getting a large range of music.

Road Trip Across America: "Cannonball" by Damien Rice

Getting Back Together: "Man on the Side" by John Mayer.  This is one of my absolute favorite John Mayer songs.  haha.

College Graduation: "London Rain" by Heather Nova.  This is also from the Dawson's Creek soundtrack.  I have almost 2000 songs on my itunes, and all I get are  the same artists/soundtracks over and over.  weird. 

Wedding:"Trouble" by Coldplay.  If that was my wedding song, I think my marriage would be doomed from the start.

Birth of Child: "Standing in the Sun" by Howie Day

Career: "Holiday in Spain" by the Counting Crows.  I am jealous of your's, Emily.  "Money Maker" totally fits for this one, and I am jealous.

Final Battle: "Cirlce of Life" from the Lion King.  Hmm...interesting.

Death Scene: "The Blower's Daughter" by Damien Rice  Hm...did I die from doing too much blow?  kididng!

Funeral Scene: "Perfect Blue Buildings" Yet another Counting Crows song. 

End Credits: "Omaha" - hmm... Counting Crows again.


dunno what I think of my results from this game.  Anyways...very excited about my John Mayer tickets.  They got sent to my mom yesterday; so, I get to get them next week.  yay!
http://lizzybug57.livejournal.com/42635.html

I love how the O.C. can make fun of itself.  Like saying that Summer's dad got a job in Seattle at this quirky Hospital Seatle  Grace.  It's like the writers knew Grey's Anatomy would be the death of the O.C.  It's like theyre writing quality writing because they are no longer being pushed like crazy by FOX....its sweet and it sucks because of the reasons i mentioned in the last one.

i actually cried in this week's thanksgiving episode.  i dont remember the last time the o.c. made me cry, but it did this week.  probably mostly because the writing and acting and the scenes in general were really good---but partially because im realizing it's ending.  

speaking of which i do really love grey's anatomy.  ill admit i watched it on thursday.  i didnt want to. i  wanted to watch the oc, but i watched greys.  i like that meredith and derek kissed at the end.  i do love that show. 

so excited that john mayer extended his tour.  i wsa really upset i didnt get to see him in nashville or atlanta with sheryl crow, but he is gonna be in both memphis and knoxville in february.  tickets went on sale this morning, and i woke up to get buy them.  my friend and i have seats on the floor---holla!
that is wayyyyy exciting!!!

we're playing arkansas today, and i really hope we win:)  we have an injured/suspended team though....and arkansas is really good this season.  it should be a tough game.
http://lizzybug57.livejournal.com/42431.html

I am just going to vent about my frustrations with FOX.  FOX has committed suicide with the oc.  granted if the writing was equal to last year's...it wouldn't really matter much.  but that isnt the case!!!!!  these 3 episodes have been WONDERFUL episodes of the show.  had FOX put it on another night (almost any other night though tuesday would be the most successful probably) and promoted it efficiently....it would have chance.  noone is watching it because noone believes or knows it is good again.  FOX has been doing a horrible job with promoting the show, and now the show will have to pay.  IT is just so aggravating because the writing and acting is so good right now.  I love Grey's and watch it and know why the hold watches it...but honestly these latest episode of the o.c. totally beat the latest episodes of grey's.  here's a link that summarizes how i feel about this whole thing.  urrr.

http://www.variety.com/article/VR1117953267.html?categoryid=14&cs=1

I'm bored.  literally.  i really need to figure out what do my american lit. paper on...and i need to do it but instead im here writing on lj and watching saved y the bell.  

i cant believe we lost to LSU in the last 9 seconds of the game.  that really sucked!

oh and my stepdad told my mom to tell me that rutgers is ranked higher than UT...which apparently is a big deal to him.  lol.

i have to go to my night class in a couple of minutes.  i really like night classes.  it is easier to attend cuz you dont have the problem with waking up for them.  plus it is way easier to the homework in them.  

oh and boys are tards...but that isn't news.

I completely forgot LJ existed.  seriously.  then i remembered, and now i am updating.  

so ummm Grey's tonight...wtf was up with those previews????  McDreamy...doing the mcnasty with someone else?  tis sad...

I'm gonna be a bumble bee for Halloween.  Get excited.

I have a paper I need to write right now; so, I guess this has been enough procrastinating.

so im going back to knox on the 12th.  

and my last day of work at Victoria's is the 10th.

Actually I'm a seasonal employee which freakin rocks cuz then I get to work the day after Thanksgiving and Christmas.  I'll need money then so that is definately great.

Isn't today the first day of the tax free weekend?

I need to start packing my room up again.

Senses tonight.  Be there.

So ummm crazy drunken night at Senses.  We pregamed at John Bailey's apartment and then headed over there and continued pregaming in the parking lot.  Lan's brother was at Senses and is 21 now so he bought us drinks.  

Ummm can you say that night was HILLARIOUS?

Then Lan got sick.  But it was definately an eventful fun crazy night.

John Mayer's  new cd comes out in September (holla!) and he'll be in Nashville on Oct. 8...and my crazy ass will be there to witness it:)
http://lizzybug57.livejournal.com/41086.html

so ive been working like crazy at victoria's secret.

My cat died in the middle of the night last night.  He has had kidney failure for awhile, and they gave him fluids and IV and he was getting them frequently and he was getting better.   and then he quit responding.  it went downhill from there really fast.  

i decided to come home this weekend to take care of him and hold h im whil my rents were out of town.  he didn't make it to this weekend, but i still wanted to come home so i could go to his funeral.

it is probably a good thing i came home.  my dog is not doing well.  she is around 18 years old...and her body is giving out on her.  i am glad i get to spend time with her this weekend.

im not used to my pets dying.  it isnt easy.  its worse cuz im so far away.  finley (my cat) tried so hard to fight death...and i begged for him to make it till i got home so i could hold him and say goodbye--but it didnt happen.  i know he tried to make it.  he just wasnt strong enough.

figured I'd write a letter to Santa where I'm nice and not naught:)
Dear Santa...

Dear Santa,

This year I've been busy!

In November I bought porn for (10 points). Last week I ruled Duluth, Minnesota as a cruel and heartless dictator (-700 points). In September I gave a life-saving blood transfusion (50 points). Last Thursday I ruled Asscrackistan as a kind and benevolent dictator (700 points). Last Saturday I donated bone marrow to in a life-saving procedure (300 points).

Overall, I've been nice (360 points). For Christmas I deserve a new dolly!

Sincerely,
lizzybug57
